Job Description
At TEKsystems People are at the heart of every successful business initiative. Every year we place over 80,000 IT professionals globally to support clients on transformation program, including Digital, AI and Cloud initiatives. We work with a broad client
 base including Banks/ Insurance and financial services, Technology Start-ups, Retail and commercial sector.


We are excited to introduce our 
Graduate Trainee Program
 this year- this is a fast-track career progression opportunity to work with some exciting client projects in a regional and global scale. During this year, you’ll work with one of
 our partner client to work and train on the job. You will gain exposure to develop strong set of consulting and technical skills while working alongside some of the world’s leading technology experts in

Digital, Cognitive and Cloud projects (Salesforce CRM/ Big data analysis/ RPA/ Digital Transformation)-
 learning from their experience as you take on increasing challenges and responsibilities; all of which provides opportunity for strong career
 growth. After the 12- month program, you will also have the opportunity to be placed in a variety of different roles including but not limited to: Data Analyst, BI Consultant and Digital Business Analyst.



Mentorship and training sessions will also be provided!


 Qualifications:




Bachelor Degree or above in Information Management, Computer Science, Software Engineering or related IT discipline

Excellent communication skills in both Cantonese and English

Keen passion to demonstrate interest in and learn Agile and International Technology environment

Self-initiative, detailed-oriented with excellent analytical skills

Company Overview
About GIA 


Established in 1931, GIA is the world’s foremost authority on diamonds, colored stones, and pearls. GIA exists to protect all purchasers of gemstones, by providing the education, laboratory services, research and instruments
 needed to accurately and objectively determine gemstone quality. As creator of the 4Cs and the GIA International Diamond Grading System™, the Institute sets and maintains the standard for grading and identification practices used worldwide. GIA’s corporate
 headquarters are located in the United States in Carlsbad, California.




As the world’s most respected gemological laboratory, GIA is entrusted with grading and identifying more gems than any other lab, including famous diamonds like the Hope, the Taylor-Burton, the De Beers Millennium Star, and the
 Incomparable. Located in major gem and jewelry centers around the world, GIA laboratories are staffed by expert diamond graders and gemologists, whose work sets the standard for grading practices worldwide.

 and jewelry-making centers, each of GIA’s seven global campuses offers students a respected education with a unique perspective on the industry.




The position:
  We’re looking for a self-motivated, enthusiastic and resourceful Instructor / Teaching Assistant for GIA Hong Kong Campus’ Education Department.




Work Hours:
 Monday to Friday, shift work for day and night classes.




Job Overview:

GIA is seeking individuals who have a passion for mentoring, excellent customer service, problem solving and a desire to work with diverse cultures to join our education team as an

Candidates with less experience and qualification will be considered as Teaching Assistant. Position provides administrative support and customer service to students and instructors

Ability to demonstrate a command of theory and contemporary knowledge, and continuing study in the field.

Ability to set up classrooms conducive to learning and meeting GIA standards.


Ability to relate with students and their ongoing issues. 


Ability to multi-task on various administrative duties and adapt to a fast-paced office environment with multiple priorities. 


Strong written and verbal communication skills. 


Experience in understanding and pin-pointing student difficulties.

job_name: Senior Manager / Associate Director, Financial Controllership
job_details:
Job Highlights
Global Professional Services Firm
A Step-Up Opportunity
Modern Causeway Bay Office Location
Job Description
Vistra has a diverse global workforce of more than 4,500 people from 45 corners of the world. We are in major city centers like Hong Kong, Amsterdam, Luxemburg, Poland, Bangalore and New
 York. High growth areas like Shenzhen, Warsaw, Abu Dhabi and Kuala Lumpur. Whether you are an expert in trusts, funds or corporate services, a specialist with experience in specific jurisdictions; or someone who is skilled in a support service, you will find
 Vistra geographically and culturally diverse, but with shared values and goals.



Position Description and Scope:


We are looking for a results-driven and confident Financial Controller to manage and improve our organization's financial performance and direct our global accounting operations. The role
 is critical for evaluating and managing risk, ensuring compliance with regulations and accounting standards, publishing financial statements, overseeing accounting operations, analyzing financial data, coordinating auditing processes, and ensuring accurate
 financial information.


The head office-based role, will have global responsibility and involve interaction, consolidation and oversight across all 81 offices and 45 jurisdictions that Vistra operates in.


Key Responsibilities:




Lead the monthly consolidated financial statement preparation process


Ensure the quality and accuracy of the Group's reporting; both in terms of accuracy of numbers as well as timeliness of reporting


Lead intercompany transaction reporting and identifying ways to enhance efficiency for intercompany reconciliations


Produce reports and other analysis breakdown using Hyperion Financial System (HFM)


Involvement in the roll out of our new ERP system


Familiarity with all the relevant accountant standards


Ensure the newly developed Intangible Asset Policy is being followed with all the major IT projects that are currently underway and, in the pipeline,


Proactively manage and continuously improve the overall quality of the Group's financial reporting and internal control environment.


Give instructions and provide guidance to Finance team across the world in accounting policies and technical accounting as required


Coordinate and liaise with external auditor & monitoring the external audit process


Supporting the Executive Director, Group Finance in developing the world-wide finance function in financial controls, processes & reporting


Review all existing Finance policies to ensure they are up-to-date and relevant plus assist to create new policies where required


Assist the CFO, Audit & Risk Committee and EXCO with ad-hoc projects




Attributes/Technical Skills:




Detailed minded with good analytical and problem solving skills


Excellent communication skills;


Good team player with excellent stakeholder management skills


Ability to multi-task and prioritize different requests


Strong interpersonal capabilities and ability to work cross - functionally with international teams and management on all levels


Highly motivated with ability to deal with ambiguities


Experienced in HFM and SAP




Requirement:




Degree holder in Finance, Accounting or related discipline


Professional qualification: Certified Public Accountant (CPA), CIMA


Minimum 10 years working experience with a minimum of 3 years in a group consolidation role within a public MNC company HQ

(on your CV, please clearly state your relevant

knowledge
 in the scope of

financial
 controllership and consolidation)

Highly technically sound accountant with a Big 4 background (up to at least Manager Level).


Ability to work with and influence a globally spread out group of senior finance directors and other senior managers across the Group


Ability to deal with ambiguities and work within ill-defined boundaries and challenge status quo


Culturally sensitive and experienced in dealing with multiple overseas offices




Please email your CV and state ‘Position’ in the subject headline and send to: 
[email protected]
 com



For more information about us please visit our company's website at www.Vistra.com


Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted, and all applications will be treated in strict confidence.



(We are not accepting any unsolicited resumes from search firm recruiters)

job_details:
Job Highlights

Job Description
Our client, a leading investment bank is looking for a Project Manager with Technology & Operational Risk experience in driving Asia regional projects. The selected candidate will be working with various
 business and technology stakeholders in driving business expansion projects across both technology and operational risk initiatives.


Responsibilities:




Provide project management and business analysis on regional and global change projects, including mandatory Change the bank projects. Driving business analysis and feasibility study on potential projects.


Work with different businesses and technology teams in overseeing and tracking the technology project portfolios related to the Technology and Operational Risk area.


Support Risk Management processes and procedures, as well as related applications and tools across the firm.


Act as an advisor related to firm policy and procedures, system dependencies, and division best practices.


Work with technology silos, operations, and finance in coordinate front to backtesting.


Manage and deliver region-specific Technology and Operational Risk Change projects.


Lead and implement the projects from end to end delivery.


Identify project risk and mitigate business risk.




Requirements:




10 years of working experience with a major management consultancy or in the banking industry.


Hands-on project management skills.


Strong Experience in the financial industry with exposure to both Technology and Operational Risk matters or projects.


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.


Good technical experience in SDLC and Project Lifecycle.


Strong organizational skills to manage multiple demands and changing priorities.


Great personality to work effectively with all levels of stakeholders across the organizations.


Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English. Candidates who speak and write Chinese (Mandarin) would be a great plus.


Bachelor degree from a reputed University
